snippet: The Spanish authorities have arrested several men accused of recruiting volunteers for insurgencies from Western Africa to Syria and Iraq.
abstract: Spanish police detain nine people in Madrid on suspicion of recruiting militants for insurgent group Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; authorities have been cracking down on network of Islamic militants in Melilla, Spain, as well, which they say has recruited and dispatched young volunteers to join insurgencies from Mali to Libya to Syria.

byline.contributor: Raphael Minder contributed reporting from Madrid.

lead_paragraph: The Spanish authorities have arrested several men accused of recruiting volunteers for insurgencies from Western Africa to Syria and Iraq.

headline.main: Spanish Police Target Cells Recruiting War Volunteers
headline.print_headline: Spanish Police Target Cells Recruiting War Volunteers

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
